newsitem.title: CANADA: Toronto stocks finish at new highs on earnings.
newsitem.headline: Toronto stocks finish at new highs on earnings.

text.p: Toronto stocks hit their fourth straight record high on Wednesday, propelled by healthy earnings and the prospect of lower Canadian interest rates.

The TSE 300 Index soared 43.02 points to a record close of 5576.01, extending its record-setting streak since last Friday. Trading was very heavy with 103.1 million shares exchanging hands worth C$1.6 billion ($1.2 billion).
"There has been some concern about the integrity of earnings of Canadian companies, but they are coming on stream here," said Fred Ketchen, director of equity trading for ScotiaMcLeod Inc.
Strong gains in conglomerates, communications and utilities and golds powered 11 of 14 sub-groups higher. The weak side was led by a 56-point drop in transportation.
Advancing stocks narrowly outnumbered declines 473 to 462 with 306 issues flat.

A strong Canadian dollar and the potential for lower Canadian rates added to the buoyant mood in equities, Kethcen said. "There is continuing optimism that there will be a further rate cut by the Bank of Canada because the dollar was higher today and could support a rate cut," he said.
* Telecommunications giant Northern Telecom Ltd. led net gainers, jumping 5.50 to 87.20, a 52-week high. The company's third quarter profits on Tuesday beat analysts' estimates.
* BCE Inc., Canada's biggest publicly-traded firm, pushed the utilities group ahead. BCE closed up 2.45 at 61.75, a 52-week peak, after reporting higher third quarter profits.
* Canadian Pacific Ltd. sparked the conglomerates sector to a 210-point rally. CP jumped 1.20 to close at 33.30 after earlier hitting a 52-week high of 33.75 on good earnings.

* In the weak transportation group, Air Canada fell 0.20 to 5.10. The airline's president, Lamar Durrett, said he would not be surprised if low-cost, U.S.-based Southwest Airlines entered the Canadian market.
